title: HGUTheme
text: basic functions return colour HEX codes. can seen useful set colours various aspects plots visualisations  well returning individual colours, palettes based logo can also returned contain every colour logo can used create plots
code: ukri_light_blue() #> [1] "#00BAD2" barplot(   3:1,   col = ukri_light_blue() ) ukri_blues() #> [1] "#2D2E5F" "#3A88A9" "#00BAD2" barplot(   3:1,   col = ukri_blues() )

title: HGUTheme
text: UKRI blues palette three colours , however, want use colours plot? can also interpolate colours based theme, say want use 5 colours UKRI blues can use can used plots like following

title: HGUTheme
text: ggplot2 popular plotting library tidyverse. used create high quality visualisations. example basic ggplot2 plot given  plots made ggplot2 created layers. Another layer can added HGUTheme recolour plot unit logo colour themes.  layers changing colour fill aesthetics plot. functions end either c d indicating whether using continuous discrete scale. continuous scales, v0.1.0 HGUTheme automatically interpolate colours logo, shown CRUK logo colour theme.  important note, layers used HEX code functions can used supply arguments pre existing ggplot2 layers similar effects, example user wanted recreate plot without dark blue, can acheived via
code: plot_data <- tibble(   x = LETTERS[1:5],   y = 5:1 )  plot_data %>%   ggplot() +   aes(x = x, y = y, fill = x) +   geom_col() + theme_classic() +   guides(fill = "none") +    labs(x = "Group", y = "Value") plot_data %>%   ggplot() +   aes(x = x, y = y, fill = x) +   geom_col() + theme_classic() +   guides(fill = "none") +    labs(x = "Group", y = "Value") +   scale_fill_ukri_d() tibble(   x = runif(1500),   y = runif(1500) ) %>%   filter(     (x - 0.5)^2 + (y - 0.5)^2 < 0.25   ) %>%   mutate(     col = (x - 0.5)^2 + (y - 0.5)^2   ) %>%   ggplot() +   aes(x = x, y = y, colour = col) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   guides(colour = "none") + coord_equal() +   scale_colour_cruk_c() tibble(   x = runif(1500),   y = runif(1500) ) %>%   filter(     (x - 0.5)^2 + (y - 0.5)^2 < 0.25   ) %>%   mutate(     col = (x - 0.5)^2 + (y - 0.5)^2   ) %>%   ggplot() +   aes(x = x, y = y, colour = col) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   guides(colour = "none") + coord_equal() +   scale_colour_gradient(     low = cruk_light_blue(),     high = cruk_pink()   )

what: Colour Your Plots With the MRC HGU Colour Theme
title: Colour Your Plots With the MRC HGU Colour Theme
text: unofficial package help create plots align colour themes MRC Human Genetics Unit units Institute Genetics Cancer, Edinburgh. functions return colours used respective theme, return palettes interpolate colours respective theme layers can added ggplot2 plots automatically scale colour fill aesthetics. palettes created align colour schemes respective institutions designed use plots. Therefore, please thoughtful use colours may effect colourblind people interpretting plots. information making scientific plots colourblind friendly can found Colour Blind Friendly Plotting section.

title: Interpolated HEX Codes of the CGEM Colours — cgem_colours_n
text: Access HEX codes colours interpolated used CGEM logo.

title: Interpolated HEX Codes of the CGEM Colours — cgem_colours_n
code: cgem_colours_n(   n,   colours = cgem_colours(),   bias = 1,   space = "Lab",   interpolate = "linear",   alpha = FALSE,   ... )

title: Interpolated HEX Codes of the CGEM Colours — cgem_colours_n
text: n number colours return. colours colours interpolate . default set colours CGEM logo. bias positive number. Higher values give widely spaced colours higher end colour spectrum. space character string indicating whether colours interpolated RGB CIE Lab colour spaces. interpolate character indicating whether spline linear interpolation method used. alpha logical value indicating whether alpha channel returned. ... Arguments passed grDevices::colorRampPalette.

title: Interpolated HEX Codes of the CGEM Colours — cgem_colours_n

text: layer can added ggplot2 plots change colour aesthetic interpolate values colours used CGEM logo.

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Continuous) — scale_colour_cgem_c
code: scale_colour_cgem_c(   ...,   colours = cgem_colours(),   midpoint = NULL,   space = "Lab",   na.value = cruk_grey(),   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Continuous) — scale_colour_cgem_c
text: ... Arguments passed ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient2. midpoint midpoint (data value) diverging scale. Diverging scale used midpoint equal NULL, default. space Colour space calculate gradient. na.value Colour used missing values. guide Type legend. aesthetics aesthetic apply scale . low Colour low end gradient. mid Colour midpoit gradient. high Colour high end gradient.

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Continuous) — scale_colour_cgem_c
text: layer can added ggplot2 object.

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Continuous) — scale_colour_cgem_c
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(   data.frame(     x = runif(1500),     y = runif(1500)   ) ) +   aes(x = x, y = y, colour = x) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   guides(colour = "none") +   coord_equal() +   scale_colour_cgem_c()

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Discrete) — scale_colour_cgem_d
text: layer can added ggplot2 plots change colour aesthetic interpolate values colours used CGEM logo.

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Discrete) — scale_colour_cgem_d
code: scale_colour_cgem_d(   aesthetics = "colour",   scale_name = "CGEM_Colours",   palette = cgem_colours_palette_func_gen(),   name = ggplot2::waiver(),   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   labels = ggplot2::waiver(),   limits = NULL,   expand = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.translate = TRUE,   na.value = cruk_grey(),   drop = TRUE,   guide = "legend",   position = "left",   super = ggplot2::ScaleDiscrete )

title: CGEM Logo Colour Scales (Discrete) — scale_colour_cgem_d
text: aesthetics names aesthetics scale works . scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. palette palette function called single integer argument (number levels scale) returns values take. name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. breaks Passed ggplot2::discrete_scale(). labels Passed ggplot2::discrete_scale(). limits Passed ggplot2::discrete_scale(). expand Passed ggplot2::discrete_scale(). na.translate Setting FALSE remove NA values colour theme. na.value colour NA values drop unused factor levels omitted scale? guide function used create guide name. position position scale. super super class use constructed scale.

code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(   data.frame(     x = runif(800),     y = runif(800),     col = sample(LETTERS[1:2], 800, replace = TRUE)   ) ) +   aes(x = x, y = y, colour = col) +   geom_point() + theme_classic() +   guides(colour = "none") +   coord_equal() +   scale_colour_cgem_d()

title: Interpolated HEX Codes of the UKRI Blues — ukri_blues_n
text: n number colours return. colours colours interpolate . default set blues UKRI logo. bias positive number. Higher values give widely spaced colours higher end colour spectrum. space character string indicating whether colours interpolated RGB CIE Lab colour spaces. interpolate character indicating whether spline linear interpolation method used. alpha logical value indicating whether alpha channel returned. ... Arguments passed grDevices::colorRampPalette.

title: HGUTheme 0.0.1
